1.2. Development Options¶

1.2.1. Time Series API¶

Time series can be efficiently stored, queried and processed using a C API with high throughput for data ingestion and fast export. Each time series is a sequence of timestamp/value pairs that allows for out-of-order ingestion and thread-safe access. More information about time series storage is available in Time Series Storage C API.

1.2.2. IoT Streams API¶

IoT streams provide the ability for real-time data analytics and continuous queries. For example, devices can group multiple sensor streams, limit query results to a recent time window and react to changes in real-time. Applications create queries for data streams using an embedded C API, described in IoT Stream Embedded C API Reference.

1.2.3. Embedded Table API¶

Table cursors are a low-level interface to access individual tables and indexes directly in C and C++ programs. Each table cursor operation has strict limits on CPU and memory resource utilization. Developers can mix SQL cursors and table cursors in the same program. More information about table cursors is available in C Table Cursors and C++ Table Cursors.
